author: Trupti Biradar
title: Uzbekistan Airways to begin weighing passengers
text:
Uzbekistan Airways to begin weighing passengers TRUPTI BIRADAR Last updated 09:48, August 13 2015 Я (личный) via Wikimedia Commons 
Uzbekistan Airways is asking its passengers to weigh in before a flight. 
Uzbekistan Airways has announced it will begin weighing passengers, and their carry-on bags, to ensure "flight safety". 
Passengers will be asked to weigh in at a "special weighing machine" in the departure zone and all data will remain anonymous, according to the airline. 
The weighing machine will only categorise passengers by gender and age group. "According to the rules of International Air Transport Association, airlines are obliged to carry out the regular procedures of preflight control passengers weighing with hand baggage to observe requirements for ensuring flight safety" the airline said in a statement. it is unclear if passengers will incur a fee if they exceed a maximum weight limit. 
In 2013, Samoa Air introduced a 'pay as you weigh airfare system' that was touted a success. 
A Norwegian professor has also previously suggested that airlines adopt a similar scheme where heavier passengers would have to fork out more for an airline ticket. 
Would you object to being weighed before a flight? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.
